title: Tutorial
body:
Can I really do this? I’ve never even held a minimum-wage job before… What if I can’t keep up?
<< set $c1S to false >>  << set $c2S to false >> << set $c3S to false >>

title: Customer1
body:
I see there’s a new face around here! It’s been a while since that has happened. The old man always insisted on doing everything himself.
One coffee please!
[[ (Give coffee) |giveCoffee1]] [[ Sure thing! |thanks1]]

title: makeDrinks
body:
Would you like to make a drink?
[[ Yes |drinkChoices]] [[ No |No]]

title: makePastries
body:
Would you like to make a pastry?
[[ Yes |pastryChoices]] [[ No |No]]

title: Customer3
body:
I heard about the news. I’m sorry for your loss… Though I’m happy that you decided to take up the cafe! Your grandfather would’ve been happy to see you keep his life’s work going. 
With that being said, just a coffee for me!
[[ (Give coffee) |giveCoffee3]] [[ Sure thing! |thanks3]]

title: Customer2
body:
I love the aesthetic here but I wish there were more pastry options… 
I would like a cake please!
[[ (Give cake) |giveCake2]] [[ Sure thing! |thanks2]]

title: cakeMade
body:
<<Cake>>
You made cake!

title: pastryChoices
body:
What pastry would you like to make?
[[ Cake |cakeMade]] [[ Never mind |No]]

title: coffeeMade
body:
<<Coffee>>  
You made coffee!

title: drinkChoices
body:
What drink would you like to make?
[[ Coffee |coffeeMade]] [[ Never mind |No]]

title: giveCake2
body:
<<if $cake == true>> 
<<removeCake>>
<< set $c2S to true >>
Thank you for the cake! 
<<else>>
It seems like you didn't bring any cake with you.
<<endif>>

body: Once you make it, please bring it to me! Thank you!

title: Week2intro
body:
Hopefully it's just like last week.
<< set $c4S to false >>  << set $c5S to false >> << set $c6S to false >> << set $c7S to false >>  << set $c8S to false >> << set $c9S to false >>

title: introTutorial
body:
Hello! (Press "z" to go to next dialogue line and/or choose an option)
Hold "x" to make text scroll faster.
Use arrow keys to move around.
Press "e" to interact with objects and customers.
And thats pretty much it! Welcome to the game!
 [[Answer:introLore|introLore]]

title: Week4intro
body:
It’s been weeks and I feel like I’m not getting enough done. Sometimes I wonder if this is really what Grandpa wanted for me. He must’ve had higher expectations of me.
<< set $c22S to false >>  << set $c23S to false >> << set $c24S to false >> << set $c25S to false >>  << set $c26S to false >> << set $c27S to false >> << set $c28S to false >>  << set $c29S to false >> << set $c30S to false >> << set $c31S to false >>  << set $c32S to false >> << set $c33S to false >> << set $c35S to false >> << set $c36S to false >> << set $c37S to false >>

title: Week3intro
body:
Another week.
<< set $c10S to false >>  << set $c11S to false >> << set $c12S to false >> << set $c13S to false >>  << set $c14S to false >> << set $c15S to false >> << set $c16S to false >>  << set $c17S to false >> << set $c18S to false >> << set $c19S to false >>  << set $c20S to false >> << set $c21S to false >>

title: summary1
body:
That wasn't so bad.
(Unlocked donuts!)
<<week2>>
[[ Go to next week |week2Load]]

title: week2Load
body: Fast Forwarding to next week...

title: week4Load
body: Fast Forwarding to next week...

title: summary3
body:
This is getting so exhausting. This cafe was meant to be my grandfather’s dream, not mine. Should I just give up and sell it? But then I’d let him and our customers down… 
<<week4>>
[[ Go to next week |week4Load]]

title: summary2
body:
There are so many things to do! How can I make time to think about improving this old place when I’m always busy with customers? How did Grandpa do this all by himself?!
(Unlocked tea!)
<<week3>>
[[ Go to next week |week3Load]]

title: week3Load
body: Fast Forwarding to next week...

title: summary4
body:
....
..........
<<endChoices>>
[[ Go to next week |endingLoad]]

title: endingLoad
body: Fast Forwarding to ??? week...

title: endingChoices
body:
Weeks pass and you slowly begin to develop a routine. It’s starting to feel a lot easier and your customer base is growing steadily.
The cafe is no longer being overshadowed by its competitors. Your customers love the changes you’ve made.
You still have feelings of self-doubt from time to time but you’re feeling more confident in your skills now! Grandpa would’ve been proud of you. :)
Ending achieved!!!

title: Customer8
body:
I didn’t know this place was still open. When I heard that the owner had passed, I thought it would shut down. I’m glad to see it’s still going, I’ve been coming here ever since I was a kid.
One cake please!
[[ (Give cake) |giveCake8]] [[ Sure thing! |thanks8]]

title: introLore
body:
You inherit a cafe from your late grandfather and are tasked with reviving it.
It’s an old but classic cafe. The furniture, decorations, and menu items haven’t been changed at all since it first opened.
At first glance, everything seems fine but your customer base is slowly dwindling down. 
It used to have such loyal customers but they’ve grown tired of the same thing over and over again. 
It’s difficult to compete with the newer, trendier cafes. You could’ve just given up and sold the place but it’s been in the family for decades.
It’d be a shame to lose it… There are still quite a few regulars who would hate to see this place go.
You should probably organize/clean the place first. (Go near the cups and plates to organize/clean them!)

title: teaMade2
body:
<<greenTea>>  
You made green tea!
